intro: Specularia falcata f. scabra, commonly known as the roughleaf sandwort, is a flowering plant in the family Montiaceae. It is characterized by its succulent, hairy leaves that are often covered in a fine, rough texture. The plant produces small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America, particularly in the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. This perennial species is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to thrive in dry, sunny conditions.
